intro: Tricera brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed trichocline, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its short, sturdy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and they bloom in late summer. Tricera brevipes is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access groundwater.
